author: philngo
content: I will add that for our client team (not sure about others) to improve shipping timelines requires some harder coordination on freezing the scope of the fork as early as possible and enforcing that freeze as a signal to start cleaning up (e.g. merging to trunk branches) and hardening the client code (the phase we're currently in right now with devnets and before testnets). This phase can be very unpredictable because this is where we uncover most of the implementation problems in our client and it does require time to fix. But we can minimize these problems by clearly signalling and rejecting any additional scope creep early so we're confident no major refactors will be coming, which is partially the reason why we didn't get fusaka into our unstable earlier.
